messages.subject: Re: pregnancy dreams wasRe: [UnschoolingDiscussion] Re: biological questions regarding adoption
messages.messageBody:
<< << Am I the only one who had SEX dreams while pregnant?


>No!


-=-I want to thank everyone for not leaving me out in the dark on this one.
I

don't usually mind being odd woman out, but....-smile- >>
-=-You know, you CAN make money at written porn. Have considered it, 'cause

I'm not bad at it. Now, of course, I dont' have TIME to write anything.-=-

It's funny, because I would have the nastiest fantasies while pregnant, and
as soon as the babies were born, I would be disgusted with myself or anyone
else who had ever thought anything so disgusting. When the babies weaned I was
neutral about it again. So it had to have been hormonally induced. And I
probably couldn't make any money without that "induction." <bwg> And wouldn't I be
disgusted with myself entirely as soon as I smelled a grandchild's head or
something? Best to just stay off roller coasters, I guess.

But I did learn alot about the power of hormone storms, and I try to remember
that when Kirby is having a season and is impatient with the rest of us.
Marty has shorter ones, and I just try to give him the day or week he needs.

I can't believe how big these boys are, who were seven pound bitty things
once. And hairy, and strong, and resourceful and reliable. But they don't get
all that growth without some spurt-spurts. And I wouldn't want them to grow
up without whatever manliness was theirs with the package. But it can be
frustrating, and memories of the power of hormones on me more lately helped me be
calmer through it.

Sandra

messages.subject: Re: pregnancy dreams wasRe: [UnschoolingDiscussion] Re: biological questions regarding adoption
messages.messageBody:
<< Am I the only one who had SEX dreams while pregnant?

>No!

I want to thank everyone for not leaving me out in the dark on this one. I
don't usually mind being odd woman out, but....-smile-

Kelly

messages.subject: Re: pregnancy dreams wasRe: [UnschoolingDiscussion] Re: biological questions regarding adoption
messages.msgSnippet: ... You know,  you CAN make money at written porn.  Have considered it, cause I m not bad at it.  Now, of course, I dont have TIME to write anything. But
messages.messageBody:
>Third time, I wrote some down, wishing I'd done it the second time.

You know, you CAN make money at written porn. Have considered it, 'cause
I'm not bad at it. Now, of course, I dont' have TIME to write anything.

But wouldn't mind being the next Anais Nin.

Kelly

messages.subject: Re: pregnancy dreams wasRe: [UnschoolingDiscussion] Re: biological questions regarding adoption
messages.msgSnippet: ** Have considered maybe, after the kids are grown,  getting some doctor to dose me with whatever pregnant women are full of so I can become a famous author of
messages.messageBody:
** Have considered maybe, after the kids are grown, getting some doctor
to dose
me with whatever pregnant women are full of so I can become a famous author
of "women's erotica" (word porn). I don't think it pays much, though,
seein'
as how people do it for free. Oh well... One of those temporary
hormone-induced career possibilities. <g>**

Yeah, I have a friend who came to the conclusion, during her third
pregnancy, that she could make a good income writing porn (under the
influence of the pregnancy hormones).

Funny that this never gets talked about in polite society. <g>

I personally had a big hormone surge around the age of 42. Very
distracting, but fun. Unfortunately it eventually tapered off.

Betsy

PS I wish I dreamt about sex more! Regrettably I'm still having
anxiety dreams about forgetting to do my math homework. Bleeaahhh!

messages.subject: Re: pregnancy dreams wasRe: [UnschoolingDiscussion] Re: biological questions regarding adoption
messages.messageBody:
<< Am I the only one who had SEX dreams while pregnant?

No! I had dreams about my BROTHER-IN-LAW when I was pregnant with my last
baby. Ack! The scary thing is it really made me wonder if there was
something I wasn't admitting to myself! ROFL!!! Everytime I'd see him, I
felt like I was on fire. It was so strange. Once I stopped nursing, it all
ended completely. But I didn't stop nursing, or rather Chloe stopped
nursing at 10 months so it took a LONG time. Talk about feeling like a
complete loser and there's nothing you can do about it!

Shameful what we admit sometimes, isn't it???

Jen



[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: pregnancy dreams wasRe: [UnschoolingDiscussion] Re: biological questions regarding adoption
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 5/21/04 9:48:18 PM, mina@mabb.net writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 5/21/04 9:48:18 PM, mina@... writes:

<< Am I the only one who had SEX dreams while pregnant? With the first kid I

had dreams that I wish to HADES I could have recorded. They were so vivid,

so complete, that I wasn't entirely sure they hadn't happened when I woke

up. >>

First pregnancy, I was more interested in sex than usual, and that was no
problem!

Second, I was interested in sex, but had a baby. Problem. Had fantasies
even while I was asleep.

Third time, I wrote some down, wishing I'd done it the second time.

Have considered maybe, after the kids are grown, getting some doctor to dose
me with whatever pregnant women are full of so I can become a famous author
of "women's erotica" (word porn). I don't think it pays much, though, seein'
as how people do it for free. Oh well... One of those temporary
hormone-induced career possibilities. <g>

Sandra

messages.subject: pregnancy dreams wasRe: [UnschoolingDiscussion] Re: biological questions regarding adoption
messages.msgSnippet: Swordfish?  Gophers? Am I the only one who had SEX dreams while pregnant?  With the first kid I had dreams that I wish to HADES I could have recorded.  They
messages.messageBody:
Swordfish? Gophers?

Am I the only one who had SEX dreams while pregnant? With the first kid I
had dreams that I wish to HADES I could have recorded. They were so vivid,
so complete, that I wasn't entirely sure they hadn't happened when I woke
up. Except that hubby was working nights, so he couldn't have been there!

And I mean X rated, clear as a bell, and darned good, too.

Ok, everyone tell me how weird that is, go ahead. -sigh- I'm always the
odd ball out.

Kelly
(who sadly didn't get those dreams with the other two)
